title: Drawing, 1780–90
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, on paper
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: The chair stands on curved feet- the upper part straight and the lower curved inward. The arms are gently sloping, curved up, terminating in floral rosettes. The seat has the shape of an oval with rectangular extensions in the middles. The arms support the extentions. The lower part of the frame of the back is connected with the seat by curved fillets. Panels filled by trellis.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1780–90.
1780–90. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-433.
